item.title: [C++] Tutorial 1 (Starting_In_C++)
item.dc:creator: @thiefmn6092 thiefmn6092
item.description:
@thiefmn6092 wrote:

[quote=“capndurk, post:1, topic:72060”]i wouldn’t recommend

system("pause");

to halt the program before exiting, because it launches two different programs to execute successfully. you should use

std::cin.get();

also you should let people know that braces {} are used in general for putting multi-line code into blocks (such as if, for, functions, etc.)

other than that, not bad[/quote]
Affirmative.

Read full topic

item.title: [C++] Tutorial 1 (Starting_In_C++)
item.dc:creator: @thiefmn6092 thiefmn6092
item.description:
@thiefmn6092 wrote:

Hello & welcome to my new series of tutorials, C++! oman, you must be surprised.

Well, before we do ANYTHING you’re going to need the toolbox( IDE & compiler ), Go to http://www.bloodshed.net/devcpp.html and download dev C++, make a new console project in C++… not C

Now, I present a bit of code!

#include <cstdlib>
#include <iostream>

using namespace std;

int main()
{
    system("PAUSE");
    return EXIT_SUCCESS;
}

Now I shall go and explain EACH line.

Code Section 1.

#include <cstdlib>
#include <iostream>

Now, when you look at the above you may think well because it says include it will probably include the file. YOU ARE RIGHT! it does and # defines a preprocessor directive which I will not explain here ( yet ).

#include <cstdlib>

^^ Include the std file, by convention files with a “c” as the first charactor are C libraries of some sort.

#include <iostream>

Includes the lib for standard output & input and some other shit, you don’t need details on this ( yet )

int main()
{
    system("PAUSE");
    return EXIT_SUCCESS;
}
int main()

^^ defines a function that will return an integer

{

^^defines the start of the function

system("PAUSE");

^^executes a system cmd, it’s just how you would put something in the dos prompt box.

return EXIT_SUCCESS;

^^ returns a value, it’s actually 1 letting the operating system know you have worked successfully. they’re just homos and like to rename shit.

}

^^ end of the function

Crredits:
Me for writing it
Pwnd for being emo ( osht )

Read full topic
